greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Greatest prime factor of n^n + (n+1)^(n+1).
comment: Becomes "hard" (unknown) around n ~ 112, cf. link: As of today, even A217435(113) (number of prime factors) is unknown. - _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 04 2012
As of today, the first unknown term is a(143). - _Daniel Suteu_, Mar 11 2019
link: Daniel Suteu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..142
Walter Nissen, np(n) = n^n + (n+1)^(n+1) -- 2 prominent questions. (Updated Oct 02 2012)
results.author: _Walter Nissen_, Aug 20 2000
